title.native: ひぐらしのなく頃に礼
title.romaji: Higurashi no Naku Koro ni Rei

description: The endless cycle of murders has been broken and Rika is finally able to settle down for a normal life with her friends. However, she is involved in a traffic accident and wakes up in a world where everything is different. A world where no one commited the sins that shaped them into the persons they are. It's up to Rika to discover the truth behind this world and whether or not it truly is perfect.

tags.name: Denpa
tags.description: Works that feature themes of social dissociation, delusions, and other issues like suicide, bullying, self-isolation, paranoia, and technological necessity in daily lives. Classic iconography: telephone poles, rooftops, and trains.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Shrine Maiden
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a shrine maiden.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Mahjong
tags.description: Centered around the game of mahjong.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

node.description: Main member of the 07th Expansion circle and creator of the popular visual/sound novel series 'When They Cry', including Higurashi no Naku Koro ni, Umineko no Naku Koro ni, and the currently releasing Ciconia no Naku Koro ni. He also is the creator of two visual/sound novels titled Rose Guns Days and Higanbana no Saku Yoru ni, and wrote the Lucia Route of Visual Arts' Key's visual novel Rewrite. His pen name is a tribute to Reina of Final Fantasy V.

__[Website](http://www.eiko-shimamiya.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/eikoshimamiya) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/eikoshimamiya) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCWHhS1bV2elLyNL60jej0cw)__

Eiko Shimamiya is a J-Pop singer and ex-member of the production group [I've Sound](https://anilist.co/staff/106951/Ive). She also handles a school called Shimamiya Size (S-size) in Sapporo, Hokkaido, Japan.

Eiko Shimamiya, also called Eiko or Peko, is a female J-pop singer-songwriter, and producer who is currently affiliated with Heart Company. She's also ex-member of the production group [I've Sound](https://anilist.co/staff/106951/Ive). Eiko also handles a school called Shimamiya Size (S-size) in Sapporo. Some of her former students are I've Sound singers [Mami Kawada](https://anilist.co/staff/100087/Mami-Kawada), [KOTOKO ](https://anilist.co/staff/100076/KOTOKO)and [Kaori Utatsuki](https://anilist.co/staff/102272/Kaori-Utatsuki). She announced on May 10, 2010, via Twitter that she was diagnosed with thyroid cancer. Her "Perfect World Live Tour", which was scheduled to begin in June, was subsequently canceled. She made an announcement of her full recovery from cancer on January 28, 2011.

[Website](http://www.kenjikawai.com/index_e.html) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B7%9D%E4%BA%95%E6%86%B2%E6%AC%A1)

After dropping out of a nuclear engineering program at Tokai University, Kawai Kenji began studying music at Shobi Music Academy. However, he dropped out after half a year. With a few friends, he created the band Muse, playing fusion rock and participating in music competitions. Through competing in such contests, the band members became technically competent to enter the music industry and decided to part ways.

After leaving Muse, Kawai Kenji began composing music for commercials in his home studio. While recording music for [Yuji Mitsuya](https://anilist.co/staff/95874/) he met music director Naoko Asari, who advised him to compose anime soundtracks. Some of his most famous anime soundtracks can be found in [Patlabor](https://anilist.co/anime/1288/), [Ranma ½](https://anilist.co/anime/210/), [Ghost in the Shell](https://anilist.co/anime/43/), [Fate/Stay Night](https://anilist.co/anime/356/), [When They Cry](https://anilist.co/anime/934/) and more recently in [Mob Psycho 100](https://anilist.co/anime/21507/).

He has worked on several projects with the director [Mamoru Oshii](https://anilist.co/staff/99097/) and has written scores for all of Hideo Nakata's films. Kenji Kawai's music has received the Annie award and Hong Kong Film Award in 2005, for [Ghost in The Shell 2: Innocence](https://anilist.co/anime/468/) he was nominated for an Annie award.

Following his success as an anime music composer, he became involved in live action movies. He contributed music to horror films: Ring, Ring 2, Dark Water, Japanese-Polish science-fiction film Avalon and the Hong Kong film Seven Swords.

For the music found in Seven Swords and A Battle of Wits he was nominated for Best Original Film Score Awards at both the 25th and 26th Hong Kong Film Awards in 2006 and 2007.

(Source: AniDB)
A freelance animator and designer, started working for Gainax in Gunbuster and Fushigi no Umi no Nadia. He left Gainax to join Gonzo, where he developed the character designs for Vandread.

__Kazuya Takase__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and founder of the sound unit I've Sound, which features the so-called "Love Planet Five", which is composed of 5 prolific singers in the Trance/J-pop industry (KOTOKO, Kaori Utatsuki, Eiko Shimamiya, MELL, and Mami Kawada).  Takase acts as a composer and arranger for the themes and OSTs of various anime and eroge games.

__Kazuya Takase__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and founder of the sound unit I've Sound, which features the so-called "Love Planet Five", which is composed of 5 prolific singers in the Trance/J-pop industry (KOTOKO, Kaori Utatsuki, Eiko Shimamiya, MELL, and Mami Kawada).  Takase acts as a composer and arranger for the themes and OSTs of various anime and eroge games.

**Spouse:** [Shouichi Taguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/112059) (December 31, 2018-)

**[Website](http://annabel.jp/)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/A_nnabel)** | **[Tumblr](https://annabel-annabel.tumblr.com/)** | **[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/a_nnabel318/)**

**Introduction:**
Annabel is a Japanese-Argentine singer-songwriter signed under the company Lantis. In regards to her personal life, most of her information was unknown, until she revealed her real name via a letter to a famous radio station. Her real given name was revealed to be the same as her artist name, which is Annabel.

**Biography:**
She began her music career in 2005. In 2006, Annabel and singer [Nagi Yanagi (やなぎなぎ)](https://anilist.co/staff/109637/Nagi-Yanagi) formed the unit [Binaria](https://open.spotify.com/artist/3SkdXeqJHKFNXuaHvrj1pL?si=CZChqP69S3O6Dw0TBvdI_w), to date, they have released 13 albums. In 2007, she formed another unit with the singer Bermel.Inazawa called anNina. As anNina, the duo performed the ending themes to the second and third seasons of *[Higurashi: When They Cry](https://anilist.co/anime/934/Higurashi-no-Naku-Koro-ni/)*, respectively named *[Higurashi: When They Cry Kai](https://anilist.co/anime/1889/Higurashi-no-Naku-Koro-ni-Kai/)* and *[Higurashi: When They Cry Rei](https://anilist.co/anime/3652/Higurashi-no-Naku-Koro-ni-Rei/)*. In 2009, she started her solo career as a singer-songwriter, under the name Annabel.

Due to her rise in popularity, she started performing theme songs for the animation industry (anime series). Her first solo was "[Anamnesis](https://anidb.net/song/48723)", which was used as the ending theme to the 2012 anime TV series *[Another](https://anilist.co/anime/11111/Another)*, the single for "Anamnesis" was released on February 8, 2012. Annabel released her second single "[Above Your Hand](https://anidb.net/song/51660)" on May 23, 2012, which was used as the ending theme song for the anime TV series *[Sankarea](https://anilist.co/anime/11499/Sankarea)*. Her third single "[Signal Graph](https://anidb.net/song/52397)", was released on July 25, 2012, which was used as the opening theme for the anime TV series *[Love, Elections & Chocolate](https://anilist.co/anime/12175/Koi-to-Senkyo-to-Chocolate)*. She released her first solo album *[Miniascape](https://anidb.net/collection/8616)* on November 28, 2012.

In 2015, she sang the vocals for the theme song of the 3DS game, 7th Dragon III Code:VFD, from the 7th Dragon series.

In 2016, she formed the band siraph with Masayuki Hasuo and Masaaki Yamasaki (whom are former [School Food Punishment](https://anilist.co/staff/102508/School-Food-Punishment) members) and Yoshimasa Terui (from the band haisuinonasa) who were a member of her backup band.

(Source: [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annabel_(Japanese_singer))

Eiko Shimamiya, also called Eiko or Peko, is a female J-pop singer-songwriter, and producer who is currently affiliated with Heart Company. She's also ex-member of the production group [I've Sound](https://anilist.co/staff/106951/Ive). Eiko also handles a school called Shimamiya Size (S-size) in Sapporo. Some of her former students are I've Sound singers [Mami Kawada](https://anilist.co/staff/100087/Mami-Kawada), [KOTOKO ](https://anilist.co/staff/100076/KOTOKO)and [Kaori Utatsuki](https://anilist.co/staff/102272/Kaori-Utatsuki). She announced on May 10, 2010, via Twitter that she was diagnosed with thyroid cancer. Her "Perfect World Live Tour", which was scheduled to begin in June, was subsequently canceled. She made an announcement of her full recovery from cancer on January 28, 2011.

**[SOUND BOX Profile (JP)](http://www.sound-box.jp/information/shizuo_k.html)** | **[SOUND BOX Profile (EN)](http://www.sound-box.jp/english/information/shizuo_k.html)**

Shizuo Kurahashi is a Japanese sound effects editor. He worked as an editor at the Nikkatsu filming studio. After that he started his sound career in ToyoOnkyo. 

He established his own company SOUND BOX in 1988. Since 1983, when the dolby stereo system got popular in Japan - he has been creating filmsounds. He has edited and arranged sounds for over 1000 works.
